parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  While it mentions the presidential elections, it does not endorse or criticize any specific candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content addresses general societal issues and calls for calm and empathy, not targeting specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be promoting a message of calm and empathy in the context of heightened political tension following the presidential elections. It does not explicitly advocate for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections. While the context is political, the call for calm is not directly tied to influencing the outcome of the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be interpreted as a form of citizen journalism, expressing an opinion on the current political climate. It offers commentary and analysis, but it does not directly promote or oppose any candidate or party in the parliamentary elections. The style is more akin to an opinion piece than electoral propaganda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. The post expresses a personal opinion on the need for calm and empathy in the face of political division. This opinion, while politically charged, does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1991823771244629</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically themed and appearing during a period of heightened political tension following the presidential elections, does not constitute electoral propaganda related to the parliamentary elections.  The post focuses on a general call for calm and empathy, avoiding any direct endorsement or criticism of specific candidates or parties participating in the parliamentary elections.  The lack of specific candidate mention, the broad appeal for societal unity, and the overall tone suggest the post aims to express a personal opinion rather than influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  The post's content aligns more with citizen journalism or opinion commentary than with electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
